questions.question: What is the primary component of the .NET Framework responsible for managing code execution?
questions.answer: CLR

questions.question: Which component of .NET provides a large set of pre-built libraries for common programming tasks?
questions.answer: FCL

questions.question: Which file extension typically represents a .NET assembly?
questions.answer: .dll

questions.question: What does the Common Type System (CTS) ensure in .NET?
options: That data types are consistent across .NET languages
That SQL types are used in .NET
questions.answer: That data types are consistent across .NET languages

questions.question: Which of the following is a cross-platform successor to the .NET Framework?
questions.answer: .NET Core

questions.question: Which of the following is true about managed code in .NET?
options: It runs under the control of CLR
It is written only in VB.NET
questions.answer: It runs under the control of CLR

questions.question: Which feature allows .NET applications to interoperate with native code?
questions.answer: P/Invoke

questions.question: What is the role of the Just-In-Time (JIT) compiler in .NET?
options: It compiles MSIL to native machine code at runtime
It translates SQL queries into .NET code
questions.answer: It compiles MSIL to native machine code at runtime

questions.question: Which configuration file is used for ASP.NET web application settings?
questions.answer: web.config

questions.question: What is the purpose of Global.asax in an ASP.NET application?
questions.answer: To handle application-level events

questions.question: What is the role of appsettings.json in .NET Core applications?
options: To manage CSS and JS resources
questions.answer: To store configuration values

questions.question: Which .NET standard defines APIs that must be implemented for code sharing?
questions.answer: .NET Standard

questions.question: In .NET, what is the main benefit of using middleware in ASP.NET Core?
options: To process HTTP requests through a pipeline
questions.answer: To process HTTP requests through a pipeline

questions.question: Which component in Entity Framework is responsible for querying the database?
questions.answer: DbContext

questions.question: What is IL (Intermediate Language) in .NET?
options: The low-level language compiled from source code before JIT
questions.answer: The low-level language compiled from source code before JIT

questions.question: Which configuration file affects all ASP.NET applications on a server?
questions.answer: machine.config

questions.question: How does .NET handle memory management?
options: Through garbage collection in the CLR
questions.answer: Through garbage collection in the CLR

questions.question: What is the purpose of the .NET CLI (Command Line Interface)?
options: To create, build, run, and publish .NET apps from the terminal
questions.answer: To create, build, run, and publish .NET apps from the terminal

questions.question: Which .NET Core file is used to manage project dependencies?
questions.answer: .csproj

questions.question: What is the function of runtimeconfig.json in .NET Core?
options: It configures runtime behavior like framework version
questions.answer: It configures runtime behavior like framework version

questions.question: What is Kestrel in ASP.NET Core?
questions.answer: A cross-platform web server

questions.question: How does .NET support microservices architecture?
options: With modular, container-friendly runtimes and APIs
questions.answer: With modular, container-friendly runtimes and APIs

questions.question: What is the role of HostBuilder in .NET Core apps?
options: It sets up dependencies, configuration, and logging for the app
questions.answer: It sets up dependencies, configuration, and logging for the app

questions.question: Which .NET feature allows platform-independent development and deployment?
questions.answer: .NET Core

questions.question: What is the role of the GC heap in .NET?
options: To store and manage managed objects during runtime
To hold session data for ASP.NET
questions.answer: To store and manage managed objects during runtime

questions.question: How does Entity Framework Core support database migrations?
options: Via command-line tools that apply schema changes incrementally
questions.answer: Via command-line tools that apply schema changes incrementally

questions.question: What is the role of the IServiceCollection in .NET Core?
options: It is used to register services for dependency injection
It maps endpoints to Razor views
It compiles and runs the middleware pipeline
questions.answer: It is used to register services for dependency injection

questions.question: Which logging providers are supported out-of-the-box in ASP.NET Core?
questions.answer: Console, Debug, EventSource, and EventLog

questions.question: What is .NET MAUI?
options: A framework for building cross-platform native apps using .NET
questions.answer: A framework for building cross-platform native apps using .NET

questions.question: What is the purpose of Blazor in the .NET ecosystem?
options: To allow web development using .NET in the browser via WebAssembly
To host Web APIs in IIS only
To deploy ASP.NET Core apps to Azure Functions
questions.answer: To allow web development using .NET in the browser via WebAssembly
